p: In Chile, current projections of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions proposed by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) indicate that temperature will increase in a North to South gradient ( IPCC, 2013). A large 2.5 °C increase is expected in the Altiplano under the most extreme emission scenario and a milder 0.5 °C increase is projected in the southern region of Magallanes for the period 2031–2050. Additionally, a 10–15% decrease in precipitation is expected in the middle of the country (between 25 and 45°S), while forecasting a 5% rainfall increase in Patagonia and a similar snowfall decrease in the Magallanes region ( Rojas, 2012).
